(This is the default if no -c/-s/-d/-o/-u/-k/-m/–resolve-undo options are specified.) -o –others Show other (i.e. untracked) files in the output

Since Git 1.7.10 introduced the support of unicode, this wiki page mentions: By default, git will print non-ASCII file names in quoted octal notation, i.
